p: Regarding concentrations, several studies have shown that the antimicrobial activity of essential oils in foods takes place at modest concentrations (200 µL/L), for example in Thymus algeriensis L. EO and Rosmarinus officinalis L. EO [ 15]. Espina et al. [ 16] also reported that the combination of low concentrations of individual constituents present in lemon essential oil (50–20 µL/L of carvacrol or citral) inactivated foodborne pathogens in fruit juices.
